CUSD is always looking for qualified individuals to join our team! To review our available openings and apply, visit: http://bit.ly/CUSDJobs

More details below:

If you enjoy working with children and making a positive impact on the educational experience of our students with special needs, we encourage you to apply for a Special Education Paraeducator opening! Both part-time and full-time positions are available!

Have you always wanted to be a teacher? Do you enjoy working with children? CUSD is looking for Certificated Substitute Teachers! If you have a Bachelor’s Degree, have passed the CBEST, and have a 30 Day Emergency Permit, we encourage you to join our substitute team!

Haven’t passed the CBEST? More information can be found on the California Educator Credentialing Assessments webpage. Once the test is passed, the 30 Day Emergency Permit information may be obtained by scheduling an appointment with the Orange County Department of Education at 714-966-4000.

We encourage you to apply! Know someone who should apply? Share this post or tag them in the comments below!

The Board of Trustees held its annual organizational meeting at the December 11, 2019 meeting to elect the Board President, Vice President and Clerk. Congratulations to Trustees Jim Reardon (President), Martha McNicholas (Vice President) and Gila Jones (Clerk)!

We were honored to host the Dana Hills High School Brass Quintet as entertainment for the meeting. Students Ryan Avillanoza, C.J. Porter, Amethyst Raubolt, Holden Abrams, and Liam Adcock performed holiday songs under the direction of James Caestecker, Director of Instrumental Music.

Dana Hills High School ASB President Danny Culleen also shared an ASB activities update.

Additionally, the Board presented two Extra Miler Awards. Capistrano Unified Council PTSA :: Educate and Inform was recognized for their work to ensure the 2019 College Fair was a success, and Music Preserves Foundation was recognized for their great work to ignite our students’ passion for music.

On December 11, the CUSD Board of Trustees appointed San Juan Hills High School Principal, Jennifer Smalley to Elementary Assistant Superintendent.

“I am honored to begin working with our elementary principals and staff. The foundations we set in elementary education lay the groundwork for our students’ success through middle and high school, and into college and career,” said Smalley.

“With the addition of Jen Smalley, we are prioritizing even greater resources on our younger students,” said Superintendent Vital. “Our goal is to improve outcomes and increase success and opportunities for young people as they prepare for middle school, high school, and beyond.”

Congratulations Jen! #CUSDProud
